Here's a synthesis of today's political news:

**Executive Actions and Administration Policies**

*   **Federal Health Worker Cuts:** The White House is reportedly preparing an order to cut thousands of federal health workers ([The Wall Street Journal](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiuAFBVV95cUxPVVJWM1NRaFl5UG42NWRwQXFrZEtNd3EwSTU4ZTlncmd2U2JOc0pOSTh1em5ERzY3T1F5anQtZDlsUnRWbkNUYWZSRC1qWTVMWGRJYV9ZWnpQVDQ1X2YwY2l5cWVGMTNoSXU2WDd2MTBOSUZ5Y1NPVVFPVGRBa3ZZQlJnNFhDcW5FQ05mSHdHd2NJYzI2VUNuQXczLXdMSkpVOUlUaWhzcFVuZDdaamc1b0VBeW1uTUhP?oc=5)).
*   **OMB Director Confirmed:** The Senate confirmed Russell Vought as the Director of the Office of Management and Budget ([The New York Times](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxNU2pjNDE2cW5kdG03RDZJeXpaUXhVcDhNczhra2hGaXotcDUwd24tUUo5V3ZSZGE1VTJHR0lBYzJMT1Q5c2FUa3JjR0NRdTJkZ0t0Q0xQakJsbkVYUmdKVUlKSXo0QjQzbkRETl9ucE1jdXNBOTl5dGt4djA5NW04QXBIVXBma0ZzaGc?oc=5)). Vought's confirmation has stirred debate, given his advocacy for Schedule F and slashing agency budgets ([Government Executive](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMizAFBVV95cUxONGpMN19xd2p6UGk5QnhwcXFlaFZ4UXpLMFR5djAzZmVIdnB3VnJjTnYxTG1qZFpYY0RYNUc2V0VpM0lTZFk5VVhXRTFVWE9jZ3RHOU80TjJYYmtscFV3ZzJwOUVWY2R0TlBhSy03cTYxa0hYbmYtS2FJYVlVYzVBWUJnMlNaVWstZEo3STljMDVGdTVHdUJ1VDU5LUMxT3lLTGFpQ0V2TlBONDlVZkpUaGM5UTdNVjlSdzBheEhjUGdTNHFSZHpoejcyZkE?oc=5)).
*   **Executive Order Testing Limits:** Trump's use of executive orders is being scrutinized, with some viewing it as a test of presidential power ([ABC News](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMisAFBVV95cUxQSGpTbVNxUlVGeTlNVVU2MXhaNlozVVVBRXhCNlV2czRNM2NIMENmNzNrWTZpWFl2VWloWTNKMU5rOEs4bjlBajVLREJIVFlDS21ROGZFWXRPcnlFTTMzTkFnbS1WWjBqWGdRRXdiQlg3ZzVwTm5Xd2tkb2JTdnJhZ2ZzNFVZcUVOYTR6N0tQeTZHaXdzeWZYYW51QWExU0s0dWIyZ3dfNm14OHNNeUpKWQ?oc=5)).
*   **Birthright Citizenship Order:** A federal judge issued a second preliminary injunction against Trump's birthright citizenship order ([ABC News](https://news.google.?oc=5)).
*   **Impoundment:** Discussions continue regarding Trump's vows to use impoundment, raising questions ([PBS NewsHour](https://news.google.?oc=5)).

**Political Strategy and Power**

*   **'Flood the Zone' Strategy:** Trump is employing a "flood the zone" strategy, leading to a week of political whiplash ([NPR](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMic0FVX3lxTE1NM0dFSGxiUEltMmxJS2tRNV9OWnhUOW50blU1UXM0bmJHMEF5S2pzS3dfdXRQeVJwN3paLUdaTU80T2VtbVpmUHk5Q2IweVNqSHA4eks3SFlmSldLVUlTTnBjSUJqRlp2QVNMYVd5VXl5dTA?oc=5)).
*   **Threat to Democracy:** Some experts are saying that Trump’s efforts to expand his power pose a direct threat to democracy ([The Guardian US](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPbzg3dTdLeldndjlheTJBemwzUFhualBFY0RjaTNnMXJSeXk3MUlWQzZ0WVpCRXhHbkRxWDFEeVlITXNaVzJ4MG5IaGp6ODUzWGEzM0U5SjVXSkllZjIxc1RoQzZ3T1h6WEhsZzdmUnZtWVp5QkFmSU81NVBsZHBVNk1GZm5rclhk?oc=5)).
*   **Unitary Executive Theory:** Trump is utilizing the "unitary executive" theory to expand presidential power ([ABC News](https://news.google.?oc=5)).

**Senate and Nominations**

*   **Cabinet and Administration Nominees:** An overview of how each senator voted on Trump's Cabinet and Administration nominees is available ([The New York Times](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMilAFBVV95cUxNOTRZTlBzeExxaXVHaWl2M2pfY1gzUEQ2Y0FtVFB5ME5JN0JJWlVsaTdneUdqRFdWMDktbW1EdWtXOEh5Mkp1MkpJUjA0Sk12NEV3MjVUN3I4aHZDOGszNHE1UEZIeV82aDgzT1lwMk9NNmlzZWlwU2cxR1pjeGxiTGRHLU5KQ1lhSmNsTTdIMW9vM2Zr?oc=5)).

**International Relations**

*   **US-Japan Relations:** Trump is scheduled to hold a news conference with Japan's prime minister ([The Washington Post](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifkFVX3lxTE1ORUtieW9PSzVpMEdVMHdZZUNVcnRiZjhkQnIyR04xM1FzZ1pjTmpycHRFYzA4Ylh0VERBMURpQlFYQmNWLWNXcXhYekl0WFRDRXVHdEd5UDNkRXRieFUzUFRIdGltU1V1SDRkTXg2eEpsSEY0V3JTVnVKbXZEdw?oc=5)).
